doc.after: Propaganda is a form of communication aimed towards influencing the attitude of a population toward some cause or position  Propaganda is information that is not impartial and used primarily to influence an audience and further an agenda often by presenting facts selectively perhaps lying by omission to encourage a particular synthesis or using loaded messages to produce an emotional rather than a rational response to the information presented
